metadata.name: Account Tampering - Suspicious Failed Logon Reasons
metadata.comment: This method uses uncommon error codes on failed logons to determine suspicious activity and tampering with accounts that have been disabled or somehow restricted.

batch.sql: SELECT * FROM authentication WHERE time BETWEEN CURRENT_TIMESTAMP() - INTERVAL 24 HOUR AND CURRENT_TIMESTAMP() AND ((lower(LOWER(metadata.event_code)) in (4625, 4776)) AND (lower(LOWER(status_code)) in ('0xc0000072', '0xc000006f', '0xc0000070', '0xc0000413', '0xc000018c', '0xc000015b')) AND NOT lower(actor.user.uid) = lower('s-1-0-0'))

output.summary: This method uses uncommon error codes on failed logons to determine suspicious activity and tampering with accounts that have been disabled or somehow restricted.

metadata.objective: False positive: User using a disabled account References: https://learn.microsoft.com/en-us/previous-versions/windows/it-pro/windows-10/security/threat-protection/auditing/event-4625, https://twitter.com/SBousseaden/status/1101431884540710913
